definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: I don't even lockmy door at night. I know everybody.
sentences.chinese: 晚上甚至不用鎖門，我認識這裏的每一個人。

sentences.english: You may run out of your house and forget to lock the door once in a while.
sentences.chinese: 隔三岔五就會慌慌張張地從家裏跑出去忘記鎖門吧？

sentences.english: It suddenly occurred to me that I had forgotten to lock the door.
sentences.chinese: 我突然想起來我還沒有鎖門呢。

sentences.english: The sack buyer was about to lock up.
sentences.chinese: 收購麻袋的人正要鎖門。

sentences.english: One day he stepped out of his room without locking the door.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，他從屋子出去的時候沒有鎖門。

sentences.english: The museum was locked up hours ago.
sentences.chinese: 博物館幾小時前就鎖門了。

sentences.english: Tust God, but don't forget to lock the door.
sentences.chinese: 相信上帝，但也要記得鎖門。

sentences.english: But we have discovered another keyhole and another key which can lock the door.
sentences.chinese: 但是我們發現了另一個鎖孔和另一把可以鎖門的鑰匙。

sentences.english: The doors will be locked one hour after the start of the dance.
sentences.chinese: 舞會開始後一小時鎖門，之後不許任何人離開。

sentences.english: Eg:To prevent anyone from breaking and entering after hours, we will be lucking the doors at midnight.
sentences.chinese: 爲防止幾個小時後有人闖入，我們將在午夜鎖門。

sentences.english: Did you remember to lock your door before you left then?
sentences.chinese: 那您離開房間之前鎖門了嗎？

sentences.english: In my haste I forgot to lock the door.
If I had known you didn’t have a key ,I wouldn’t have loked the door.
sentences.chinese: 如果我知道你沒有鑰匙，我就不會鎖門的。

sentences.english: We forgot to close dormitory's door when we went to sleep in the midnight, remaining it open widely.
sentences.chinese: 昨天深夜我們睡覺時我們忘記鎖門了，宿舍門大開着。

definition: to break the door down and enter (idiom)
locked in (with the door locked from the outside)
to fiddle with/to tamper with/to meddle with/to move randomly/to flail about
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to be made to stand still as a punishment
lit. twice every three days (idiom); practically every day/frequently
(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath
